reference.shortdesc: A choice description heading provides a specific label for the list of descriptions of options from which a user chooses in order to accomplish a step.I think "complete" a step is more appropriate than "accomplish" a step?

section.title: Processing expectations
section.p: The default label for the list of options could be a localized translation of Description.

section.title: Specialization hierarchy
section.p: The chdeschd element is specialized from the stentry element in the topic module.

example.title: Example
example.codeblock: <step><cmd>Then this</cmd> <choicetable> <chhead> <choptionhd>Do something</choptionhd> <chdeschd>Or Else this</chdeschd> </chhead> <chrow><choption>Do this</choption> <chdesc>and this will happen</chdesc></chrow> <chrow><choption>Do that</choption> <chdesc>and that will happen</chdesc></chrow> </choicetable> </step>
